This property verifies that when both the CS and WR signals are high at a rising clock edge, the mode[6] signal must be set to 1 exactly one clock cycle later.

The trigger condition occurs at any positive edge of the clk signal where CS equals 1 and WR equals 1 simultaneously.

The expected behavior is that on the immediately following clock cycle (after one clock period), the mode[6] signal must have the value 1.

The timing relationship specifies that the mode[6] check happens precisely one clock cycle after the trigger condition.

The property is evaluated on every positive edge of clk and has no explicit reset or disable conditions.

# SVA Generation Chain-of-Thought

**Property:** p_mode_6_assignment
**Type:** Assertion

## Step 1: Interface & Clock Domain Analysis

* **Signals:**
    * Design Signals: `CS`, `WR`, `mode`

* **Clocks & Resets:**
    * Primary Clock: `clk` (posedge)

* **Cross-Domain Check:** 
    * Single clock domain - no CDC concerns

## Step 2: Semantic Mapping (Primitives & Built-ins)

* **Boolean Conditions:**
    * Trigger condition: `(CS == 1 && WR == 1)`
    * Response condition: `##1 (mode[6] == 1)`

## Step 3: Sequence Construction (Bottom-Up)

* **Sequence A (Trigger/Antecedent):**
    * Description: The triggering condition that initiates property evaluation
    * Logic: `(CS == 1 && WR == 1)`

* **Sequence B (Response/Consequent):**
    * Description: The expected behavior when trigger occurs
    * Logic: `##1 (mode[6] == 1)`
    * Timing: 1 cycle(s)

* **Temporal Operators Used:**
    * `##`: Cycle delay operator

## Step 4: Property Assembly

* **Implication Type:**
    * Overlapping (`|->`) - consequent evaluation starts in the same cycle as antecedent match

* **Disable Condition:**
    * None specified - property always active

* **Assertion Structure:**
    * `@(posedge clk) (CS == 1 && WR == 1) |-> ##1 (mode[6] == 1)`

## Step 5: Final SVA Code

```systemverilog
property p_mode_6_assignment;
    @(posedge clk)
        (CS == 1 && WR == 1) |-> ##1 (mode[6] == 1);
endproperty
assert_p_mode_6_assignment: assert property (p_mode_6_assignment) else $error("Assertion failed: mode[6] is not assigned to 1 one cycle after CS and WR are both 1");
```

**Summary:**
Property `p_mode_6_assignment` uses overlapping implication synchronized to `clk`.
